title: Isolated tympanic plate fracture detected by cone-beam computed tomography: report of four cases with review of literature
patient: A 25-year-old male patient presented with moderate pain in the right preauricular region. The patient had a history of fall and a direct hit to the mandible. History of bleeding and inability to open his mouth were also reported. Clinical examination revealed pain in the right preauricular region that was exacerbated on mouth opening and presence of edema in the EAC. CBCT showed a right TPF and complete obliteration of the EAC.() The patient was advised to follow conservative treatment, and symptoms subsided within five weeks.
